title: lllUUU (JP) + NIHIL D (JP) + vvekapipo (JP)
shortText:
Lets Go Scumming:
New Music From Kyushu (JP)
pageInfoID: lllUUU (JP) + NIHIL D (JP) + vvekapipo (JP) - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent:
Sunday, April 09, 2023
IN OK/OUT KO!
Electronic
Doors open:
19:00
Showtime: 20.00
Damage: €6-9
Lets Go Scumming: New Music From Kyushu w/ lllUUU + NIHIL D + vvekapipo + WhyPeeWhy
This is their only European show.
Experimental / Noise / Modern Scum performances from musicians residing in Southern Japan.
lllUUU
She lives in Kumamoto Prefecture. She perform DJ sets and machine live performances mainly in Kyushu, focusing on dance music.
https://on.soundcloud.com/XCrHr
NIHIL D
Started activity in 2020. Belongs to SUBCODE GMKL.
https://soundcloud.com/user-213729706/tiredplace/s-ZaCF8jbA8lL
vvekapipo
Born in 2000. Dancer and sound collage artist. Organizes the noise party “herts” in Fukuoka, presenting noise to the younger scene.
https://on.soundcloud.com/SknPc
There will also be a special scum show from WhyPeeWhy.
lllUUU, NIHIL D, vvekapipo, YPY
Bookings
Payments can be made through iDeal / SEPA / PAYPAL / Credit Card

Ticket price €6.00

title: 3Head (uk) + Uncle Fester On Acid + I Believe In My Mess + Selector Ramses
shortText: Bass Music | Dub Session | Sonic Assault
pageInfoID: 3Head (uk) + Uncle Fester On Acid + I Believe In My Mess + Selector Ramses - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent:
Saturday, April 15, 2023
Reggae
Doors open:
19:30
Showtime: 20.00
Damage: €15
3Head
The core of the band are next-level musicians who’ve all already toured the world with a variety of internationally acclaimed acts including, in particular, The Tindersticks (Al is one of their founder members (and on their first 6 albums), Claina, who’s still touring with the Tindersticks). And Spider who’s played and toured with, Lee “Scratch” Perry, Mad Professor, Scientist, UB40, and Madness. We play Reggae, Dub, Breakbeat, Downtempo, Trip Hop & World Music and have toured with Adrian Sherwood, Andrew Wetherall and Dennis Bovell.
3Head will be joined on the night alongside Dr Dub on sound mixing but also on visuals by LOSD = the Laboratory Of Sonic Discovery/ Amsterdam Based radio activist Peter Fleur & Dafna Levy.
LOSD will unload a torrent of twisted images to grab you and take US all along on this unpredictable ride to IMAGINE, SEE and RIDE.
MIXMAG; “What you get when you mix the intensity of Joy Division with the space and rhythm of King Tubby!’’
TIME OUT (London); ‘’A beguiling mix of epic, steaming dub, flecked with frantic toasting, molten soul vocals all underpinned by deft break-beats…haunted and haunting 3Head create a throbbing underworld all their own.”
https://3-head.com/
https://3head1.bandcamp.com/
https://www.facebook.com/3headmusic
https://www.youtube.com/@3head103
https://www.mixcloud.com/matthew-le-maistre-smith/
Uncle Fester on Acid is the tripolar alter ego of ON.U Sound archivist, reissue curator and resident DJ Patrick Dokter, also known as Dr. Dub. On stage, he has supported/opened for the likes of Adrian Sherwood, Lee Perry, African Head Charge, Asian Dub Foundation, Mark Stewart, Headfake Sound System (Doug Wimbish & Will Calhoun of Living Colour) and Pitch Black.
As a remixer, Patrick is known for his work with Adrian Sherwood, Youth & Gaudi, Tackhead, Mark Stewart, Dub Syndicate, African Head Charge, Afro Celt Sound System, 3Head and many more. In 2020 and 2021, his reconstructions of Pitch Black’s album ‘filtered senses’ and Misled Convoy’s ‘sixteen sunsets’ were released on CD by UK-based Dubmission records. for 2023 he’s got a new album “Sonic Thirst” available on his bandcamp page.
https://ufoa.bandcamp.com/
https://soundcloud.com/user-10335594
https://www.facebook.com/CATSnPATS
I Believe In My Mess
“Their new record is absolutely fantastic!”,
aldus Undertones Michael Bradley in zijn wekelijks radioprogramma op BBC Ulster. De Noord-Ier riep het Amsterdamse duo gelijk uit tot zijn favoriete band van het moment.
Deze nieuwe plaat betrof de laatste single die zij in de zomer van 2022 hebben uitgebracht: “Dead In The Head”. Dit is de eerste single na het goed ontvangen debuutalbum “Do Unto Others”. In de loop van dit jaar zal er meer nieuw werk verschijnen.
I Believe In My Mess, dat is Frank van Praag (beats, gitaar, synths & vocals) en Geert de Groot (bas, gitaar & synth), in een parallel leven ook onderdeel van de band Scram C Baby. Hun muzikale wereld waaiert uiteen in richtingen als funk, indie, dub, electronic music, krautrock, psychedelica. Tekst en zang spelen hierin een ondergeschikte rol.
Sinds 2016 brengt het duo muziek uit op hun eigen Filthy Good Records. Sinds 2019 werkt de band hierbij samen met Excelsior Recordings. Verder heeft I Believe dubs gemaakt voor onder andere De Jeugd Van Tegenwoordig, Fatima Yamaha, Hallo Venray, Canshaker Pi en Meindert Talma.
Info: http://www.i-believe-in-my-mess.com/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=464hwhLGoa0
3Head, I Believe In My Mess, SELECTOR RAMSES, Uncle Fester On Acid
Bookings
Payments can be made through iDeal / SEPA / PAYPAL / Credit Card
Tickets
Ticket price €15.00
Booking fee €0.50Price€15,50
Spaces
1
2

title: Against the Written Word; A Book Launch by IAN SVENONiUS + ESCAPE-ISM (US)
pageInfoID: Against the Written Word; A Book Launch by IAN SVENONiUS + ESCAPE-ISM (US) - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent: Friday, April 28, 2023 IN OK/OUT KO! Rock Doors open: 20:00 Showtime: 20.30 Damage: €10 (rsvp) | €12 (door) Escape-ism is the Found-Sound-Dream-Drama starring Ian Svenonius & Alexandra Cabral Rock ‘n Roll revolutionary and punk veteran Ian Svenonius is back in town. The mythical performer, author, and filmmaker is currently taking the world by storm with his duo project Escape-Ism. Carrying only a guitar, microphone, an analogue-sounding drum machine and tape deck, Escape-Ism reinvents rock ’n’ roll the same way the jet engine reinvented travel; ripping up the stage to tiny, little bits. https://escape-ism.bandcamp.com/ Ian Svenonius is a Washington, DC-based vocalist who has fronted a number of bands throughout the 1990s and 2000s and has released solo albums under the aliases David Candy and Escape-Ism. Ian is also a writer, penning the lengthy liner notes that usually accompany his bands’ releases and publishing a NEW book; “Against the Written Word: Toward a Universal Illiteracy.” (01/03/2023, akashic book). https://www.iansvenonius.com/ “Svenonius hasn’t written a basic ‘How to Make It in the Music Business’ book. Rather, the writer, online talk show host and, most important, singer in a series of breathtaking rock ‘n’ roll bands (Nation of Ulysses, the Make-Up, Chain & the Gang), is drawing a line in the sand and doing so with what he hopes will finally define the undefinable.” — Los Angeles Times Alexandra Cabral Los Angeles based musician, photographer and director. http://alexandracabral.com/ Description ‘Against the Written Word’ is the most important, most revolutionary book produced since the advent of the printing press; the book that will liberate readers from reading, writers from writing, and booksellers from peddling their despicable wares. This book ushers in a new era of freedom from reading and all its attendant bedfellows such as Enlightenment thinking and the mass alienation wrought by the phonetic alphabet. ‘Against the Written Word’ will be a tremendous best seller and simultaneously the last book that anyone will read. With nineteen essays ripping, shredding, tearing apart all the bugaboos that haunt humanity nowadays, ‘Against the Written Word’ is a must-read for any aspiring radical or would-be gnostic who has a penchant for words, thought, clothes, intoxicants, music, art, expression, etc. The work is presented in a range of writing: essays, screenplays, lectures, sci-fi stories, and manifestos, with topics that include “the rise of incorporated man,” “tourism as the neoliberal mode of military occupation,” a workshop on songwriting for the purpose of suggestion and mind control, and many more. https://www.akashicbooks.com/catalog/against-the-written-word-toward-a-universal-illiteracy/ Alexandra Cabral, BOOK: Against the Written Word, ESCAPE-ISM, Ian Svenonius Bookings Payments can be made through iDeal / SEPA / PAYPAL / Credit Card Tickets Ticket price €10.00 Booking fee €0.50Price€10,50 Spaces 1 2 Registration Information Terms: I have read and agree to the Terms & Conditions * Payment and Confirmation I consent to my submitted data being collected and stored as outlined by the site
longTextHTML:
Escape-ism is the Found-Sound-Dream-Drama starring Ian Svenonius & Alexandra Cabral

Rock ‘n Roll revolutionary and punk veteran Ian Svenonius is back in town. The mythical performer, author, and filmmaker is currently taking the world by storm with his duo project Escape-Ism. Carrying only a guitar, microphone, an analogue-sounding drum machine and tape deck, Escape-Ism reinvents rock ’n’ roll the same way the jet engine reinvented travel; ripping up the stage to tiny, little bits.
https://escape-ism.bandcamp.com/

Ian Svenonius is a Washington, DC-based vocalist who has fronted a number of bands throughout the 1990s and 2000s and has released solo albums under the aliases David Candy and Escape-Ism. Ian is also a writer, penning the lengthy liner notes that usually accompany his bands’ releases and publishing a NEW book; “Against the Written Word: Toward a Universal Illiteracy.” (01/03/2023, akashic book).

https://www.iansvenonius.com/

“Svenonius hasn’t written a basic ‘How to Make It in the Music Business’ book. Rather, the writer, online talk show host and, most important, singer in a series of breathtaking rock ‘n’ roll bands (Nation of Ulysses, the Make-Up, Chain & the Gang), is drawing a line in the sand and doing so with what he hopes will finally define the undefinable.”

— Los Angeles Times

Alexandra Cabral
Los Angeles based musician, photographer and director.
http://alexandracabral.com/

Description
‘Against the Written Word’ is the most important, most revolutionary book produced since the advent of the printing press; the book that will liberate readers from reading, writers from writing, and booksellers from peddling their despicable wares. This book ushers in a new era of freedom from reading and all its attendant bedfellows such as Enlightenment thinking and the mass alienation wrought by the phonetic alphabet. ‘Against the Written Word’ will be a tremendous best seller and simultaneously the last book that anyone will read.

With nineteen essays ripping, shredding, tearing apart all the bugaboos that haunt humanity nowadays, ‘Against the Written Word’ is a must-read for any aspiring radical or would-be gnostic who has a penchant for words, thought, clothes, intoxicants, music, art, expression, etc. The work is presented in a range of writing: essays, screenplays, lectures, sci-fi stories, and manifestos, with topics that include “the rise of incorporated man,” “tourism as the neoliberal mode of military occupation,” a workshop on songwriting for the purpose of suggestion and mind control, and many more.

https://www.akashicbooks.com/catalog/against-the-written-word-toward-a-universal-illiteracy/

title: ATOL ATOL ATOL (PL) + LIBRARY CARD + DJ Steve
pageInfoID: ATOL ATOL ATOL (PL) + LIBRARY CARD + DJ Steve - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent:
Thursday, May 04, 2023
YUGOFUTURISM
Rock
Doors open:
20:30
Showtime: 21:00
Damage: €10
Yugofuturism presents!
Co-hosting an OCCII Amsterdam show for the brilliant post punk band Atol Atol Atol from Wroclaw/Poland, with familiar faces from among others Kurws & Przepych, supported by Library Card from Rotterdam.
ATOL ATOL ATOL
Island post-punk from the south of Poland. The tour includes: unlimited cellar snorkeling, coffee on Enewetak and Bikini atolls, free time in the central depression. The cruise crew includes: Łukasz Plata (Ukryte Zalety Systemu, Przepych), Artur Soszynski (Ukryte Zalety Systemu) and Hubert Kostkiewicz (Kurws), powered by vocalist Agata Horwat. The whole is tied together with a dub brace by master of the console Szymon Szwarc (Jesień, Rozwód). „Koniec sosu tysiąca wysp” (The End of the Thousand Island Sauce) is an angular, overstimulated, rhythmically organized yet freedom-hungry punkoid in the vein of no wave or Minutemen, with a face that resembles absolutely no one.
https://atolatolatol.bandcamp.com/
LIBRARY CARD
In the summer of 2021, Library Card originated from the close-knit Rotterdam music scene. While writing their first few songs to a drum machine, Lot van Teylingen, Mitchell Quitz and Kat Kalkman found common ground within their love for expressive and thoughtful music. Soon after, the band recruited Emre Karayalçin whose unorthodox and articulate rhythms completed Library Card’s sound.
With their first release ‘Mirror Factory’, the band clearly illustrated its ability to create captivating universes which perfectly encapsulate Van Teylingen‘s impactful and emotional storytelling. On the 19th of October the band will release the live-session of their hostile and menacing song ‘Residual Heat’. The session, shot in an empty office building, shows the band engulfing every nook and cranny with their sonic intensity.
https://thisislibrarycard.bandcamp.com/
Poster: Salla e kuqe (Red Hall), part of the larger, iconic complex of Palace of Youth and Sports in Pristina, currently hosting a rehearsal space, a library and an observatory – used by the Astronomy Club of Kosovo. It was finalized a few years after the main structure of the Palace of Youth and Sports, which was formerly known as “Boro and Ramiz”, designed by architects Živorad Janković and Halid Muhasilović and finished in 1977.
Picture found at Prishtina e Vjetër.
ATOL ATOL ATOL, DJ STEVE, LIBRARY CARD
Bookings
Payments can be made through iDeal / SEPA / PAYPAL / Credit Card
Tickets
Ticket price €10.00
Booking fee €0.50Price€10,50

title: HUMAN ALERT + OPPAKKUH! + PAUPER
shortText: Een benefiet voor Jan Switters | Amsterdam Brânt
pageInfoID: HUMAN ALERT + OPPAKKUH! + PAUPER - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent: Sunday, May 21, 2023 HC/PUNK! Rock Doors open: 19:30 Showtime: 20:00 Damage: €15 “Amsterdam Brânt” – Een benefiet voor Jan Switters Vrijdagavond 10 februari 2023 brak er brand uit in de boerderij van Ernst Langhout in Gauw, Friesland. Hier was ook ‘Studio Landscape’, de muziekopname studio van Jan Switters gevestigd. ‘Studio Landscape’ stond in Friesland maar ver daarbuiten bekend als DE studio voor herrie bands. Jan Switters zelf is/was de geluidsman chauffeur van NRA en Human Alert de afgelopen twintig jaar… Met deze avond willen we graag geld ophalen om een nieuwe muziekopname studio voor Jan Switters te realiseren. Alle opbrengsten van de entree gaan naar de nieuwe studio. HUMAN ALERT Het lot bracht Human Alert (1990-2012) eerder dit jaar weer heel even bij elkaar. Ter ere van grote vriend en drummer Menno Wigman, die in 2018 overleed, knalde het legendarische rockpunk collectief als vanouds het dak van het Patronaat eraf en veranderde de grote menigte in een vrolijk kolkende chaos. Het is duidelijk dat Human Alert niets aan actualiteit verloren is. Sterker nog, de boodschappen verpakt in hun typische theatrale punk-binnen-de-punk-stijl blijken urgenter dan ooit. Met nummers als ‘Kerk&Staat’, ‘Volk&Vaderland’ en ‘Swing Out System’ poeren ze vrolijk voort in de open wond die ‘maatschappij’ heet. En met hun grootste hit ‘I Hate People’ omvatten ze het grootste probleem aller tijden. Het noodlot dat hun geluidsman Jan Switters is overkomen doet Human Alert nogmaals terugkeren op het podium. Gelukkig zijn de vlammen gedoofd, maar het vuur in deze vriendschap niet. https://www.facebook.com/humanalert Oppakkuh! De band van Jan Switters. Oppakkuh! is de erfenis van de Friese hardcore bands Murder Inc. III & La Cosa Nostra. PAUPER Herrie uit Amsterdam. Meer introductie is niet nodig. pauper by Pauper HUMAN ALERT, OPPAKKUH!, Pauper Bookings Payments can be made through iDeal / SEPA / PAYPAL / Credit Card Tickets Ticket price €15.00 Booking fee €0.50Price€15,50 Spaces 1 2 Registration Information Terms: I have read and agree to the Terms & Conditions * Payment and Confirmation I consent to my submitted data being collected and stored as outlined by the site
longTextHTML:
“Amsterdam Brânt” – Een benefiet voor Jan Switters

Vrijdagavond 10 februari 2023 brak er brand uit in de boerderij van Ernst Langhout in Gauw, Friesland. Hier was ook ‘Studio Landscape’, de muziekopname studio van Jan Switters gevestigd. ‘Studio Landscape’ stond in Friesland maar ver daarbuiten bekend als DE studio voor herrie bands. Jan Switters zelf is/was de geluidsman chauffeur van NRA en Human Alert de afgelopen twintig jaar… Met deze avond willen we graag geld ophalen om een nieuwe muziekopname studio voor Jan Switters te realiseren.

Alle opbrengsten van de entree gaan naar de nieuwe studio.

HUMAN ALERT
Het lot bracht Human Alert (1990-2012) eerder dit jaar weer heel even bij elkaar. Ter ere van grote vriend en drummer Menno Wigman, die in 2018 overleed, knalde het legendarische rockpunk collectief als vanouds het dak van het Patronaat eraf en veranderde de grote menigte in een vrolijk kolkende chaos. Het is duidelijk dat Human Alert niets aan actualiteit verloren is. Sterker nog, de boodschappen verpakt in hun typische theatrale punk-binnen-de-punk-stijl blijken urgenter dan ooit. Met nummers als ‘Kerk&Staat’, ‘Volk&Vaderland’ en ‘Swing Out System’ poeren ze vrolijk voort in de open wond die ‘maatschappij’ heet. En met hun grootste hit ‘I Hate People’ omvatten ze het grootste probleem aller tijden. Het noodlot dat hun geluidsman Jan Switters is overkomen doet Human Alert nogmaals terugkeren op het podium. Gelukkig zijn de vlammen gedoofd, maar het vuur in deze vriendschap niet.
https://www.facebook.com/humanalert

Oppakkuh!
De band van Jan Switters.
Oppakkuh! is de erfenis van de Friese hardcore bands Murder Inc. III & La Cosa Nostra.

PAUPER
Herrie uit Amsterdam. Meer introductie is niet nodig.

title: LAMP OF MURMUUR (US) + INVUNCHE + FACELESS ENTITY
shortText: primitive punk | black metal | psychedelic rock.
pageInfoID: LAMP OF MURMUUR (US) + INVUNCHE + FACELESS ENTITY - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent:
Friday, June 02, 2023
WOLVES OF HADES
Rock
Doors open:
20:00
Showtime: 20.30
Damage: €10
♆ WOLVES OF HADES PRESENTS ♆
Wolves of Hades and OCCii will be hosting on the 2nd of June a special evening of uncompromised blackened cacophony with @lampofmurmuur @el.invunche and @faceless.entity !!!
– Lamp of Murmuur –
Hailing from Los Angeles, CA, Lamp of Murmuur has swept through the dark underground with fervour since its first appearing with a string of demos in 2019.
With three albums already under his belt, Lamp of Murmuur’s explorations in black metal stray enough to keep his approach fresh and mysterious, without compromising the extreme core of the project. Starting as a fairly orthodox one-man endeavor, it was soon apparent that behind the ghastly mist of rabid riffs and ominous synths there was a far more complex and enigmatic beast dancing behind a veil of shadows.
https://lampofmurmuur.bandcamp.com/
– Invunche –
Dutch-Chilean band formed in 2012, combining elements of primitive punk, black metal and psychedelic rock. First emerging in the physical world in 2014 with its self titled debut, offering a unique take on minimalist Ildjarn worshipping sounds. In later releases the sound evolved into to its own musical entity, adding elements of krautrock, folk and psychedelia while retaining its energetic punk origins.
Rabid and relentless, Invunche seeks to pummel its listeners into psychedelic submission.
https://invunche.bandcamp.com/
– Faceless Entity –
Ultimately ritualistic in substance, untamed in praxis, the abyss takes form and onward emanates the wisdom of the dead. Contemplate life and death. Give in to the fear of the unknown and let that fear wreak mental havoc on your psyche. Breathe in slow; your imminent demise is just around the corner. Let us mourn for you. Forever mourning the dead and the living…
https://facelessentity.bandcamp.com/
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
♆ Doors: 20:00
♆ Damage: €10-
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬

With three albums already under his belt, Lamp of Murmuur’s explorations in black metal stray enough to keep his approach fresh and mysterious, without compromising the extreme core of the project. title: THE DEAD C (NZ) + ROY MONTGOMERY (NZ)
pageInfoID: THE DEAD C (NZ) + ROY MONTGOMERY (NZ) - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent: Wednesday, June 14, 2023 IN OK/OUT KO! Rock Doors open: 20:00 Showtime: 20.30 Damage: €10 (rsvp) | €12 (door) The Dead C (NZ) + Roy Montgomery (NZ) “In this writer’s opinion, The Dead C might just be the best rock act currently active.” – The Quietus Over the moon to bring the legendary New Zealand trio of Bruce Russell, Michael Morley and Robbie Yeats, The Dead C, to OCCii. The Dead C’s improvised noise rock verges on disintegration with a trademark hazy disorientation, invariably evoking hypnotic and heavy moods. But The Dead C are no bummer. They seek liberation from shallow and easy rock conventions; amid the murk of cardboard box guitars, underwater vocals, and ramshackle drumming, a new consciousness emerges. The recognizable, sullen strumming, mumbling and lyrical ennui of Michael Morley, anchored by percussionist Robbie Yeats and punctuated by the atonal bursts of Bruce Russell coalesce in a solid front that mocks the efforts of schmaltz-peddling hacks. – Starlight Furniture Co “They truly are an act wholly unto themselves, never once letting their flirtations with structure or melody establish authority over their compositions, nor letting their mesh of noise-drenched improvisations drift into formless meandering.” – Tiny Mix Tapes “The New Zealand noise trio remain as vital, corrosive, and challenging as ever.” – Pitchfork photo: Hans van der Lingen. One of Belgium’s finest shutter bugs. Roy Montgomery A key protagonist in the Christchurch 80s noise rock scene, his minimalist post-punk band The Pin Group were the first act to release on Flying Nun and lead to other explorations in short-lived drone project The Shallows and the gloriously open-ended freedoms of noise pop outfit Dadamah. After a quiet spell, he returned in the late 90s, producing towering spires of guitar lines that exposed fragility between the strums. With his solo releases and in collaboration with Flying Saucer Attack, Bardo Pond (Hash Jar Tempo), and Chris Heaphy (Dissolve), his focus shifted from the truth-mining of rock music to epic celestialism. His ambitious yet humble tracks outstrip their origins, and Montgomery toured the world sitting cross-legged on the floor, playing twenty-plus-minute compositions. A long period of silence followed, marked only with a split album with Grouper (who lists Montgomery as a primary influence), involvement in Torlesse Super Group, and a couple of thematic variations serving as soundtracks for films. He unexpectedly re-emerged in 2016 with R M H Q (also know as Roy Montgomery’s Headquarters) on Grapefruit/Ba Da Bing, four albums of new material released simultaneously that marked a return to his distinctive pastoral guitar style but added the rare sound of his singing voice. Like all of his catalogue listening to his work is a visceral experience with repeating phrases swelling and decaying, immersing the listener in the cyclical narrative of his compositions. Bruce Russell, Michael Morley, Robbie Yeats, Roy Montgomery, THE DEAD C Bookings Payments can be made through iDeal / SEPA / PAYPAL / Credit Card Tickets Ticket price €10.00 Booking fee €0.50Price€10,50 Spaces 1 2 Registration Information Terms: I have read and agree to the Terms & Conditions * Payment and Confirmation I consent to my submitted data being collected and stored as outlined by the site
longTextHTML:
The Dead C (NZ) + Roy Montgomery (NZ)

“In this writer’s opinion, The Dead C might just be the best rock act currently active.” – The Quietus

Over the moon to bring the legendary New Zealand trio of Bruce Russell, Michael Morley and Robbie Yeats, The Dead C, to OCCii.

The Dead C’s improvised noise rock verges on disintegration with a trademark hazy disorientation, invariably evoking hypnotic and heavy moods. But The Dead C are no bummer. They seek liberation from shallow and easy rock conventions; amid the murk of cardboard box guitars, underwater vocals, and ramshackle drumming, a new consciousness emerges. The recognizable, sullen strumming, mumbling and lyrical ennui of Michael Morley, anchored by percussionist Robbie Yeats and punctuated by the atonal bursts of Bruce Russell coalesce in a solid front that mocks the efforts of schmaltz-peddling hacks. – Starlight Furniture Co

“They truly are an act wholly unto themselves, never once letting their flirtations with structure or melody establish authority over their compositions, nor letting their mesh of noise-drenched improvisations drift into formless meandering.” – Tiny Mix Tapes

“The New Zealand noise trio remain as vital, corrosive, and challenging as ever.” – Pitchfork

photo: Hans van der Lingen. One of Belgium’s finest shutter bugs.

Roy Montgomery

A key protagonist in the Christchurch 80s noise rock scene, his minimalist post-punk band The Pin Group were the first act to release on Flying Nun and lead to other explorations in short-lived drone project The Shallows and the gloriously open-ended freedoms of noise pop outfit Dadamah.

After a quiet spell, he returned in the late 90s, producing towering spires of guitar lines that exposed fragility between the strums. With his solo releases and in collaboration with Flying Saucer Attack, Bardo Pond (Hash Jar Tempo), and Chris Heaphy (Dissolve), his focus shifted from the truth-mining of rock music to epic celestialism. His ambitious yet humble tracks outstrip their origins, and Montgomery toured the world sitting cross-legged on the floor, playing twenty-plus-minute compositions.

A long period of silence followed, marked only with a split album with Grouper (who lists Montgomery as a primary influence), involvement in Torlesse Super Group, and a couple of thematic variations serving as soundtracks for films.

He unexpectedly re-emerged in 2016 with R M H Q (also know as Roy Montgomery’s Headquarters) on Grapefruit/Ba Da Bing, four albums of new material released simultaneously that marked a return to his distinctive pastoral guitar style but added the rare sound of his singing voice. Like all of his catalogue listening to his work is a visceral experience with repeating phrases swelling and decaying, immersing the listener in the cyclical narrative of his compositions.

title: SAVAGEHEADS (US) + BURNING KROSS (BE) + APPÄRATUS (MA)
pageInfoID: SAVAGEHEADS (US) + BURNING KROSS (BE) + APPÄRATUS (MA) - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent:
Thursday, June 22, 2023
HC/PUNK!
Rock
Doors open:
20:00
Showtime: 20:30
Damage: €8
SAVAGEHEADS
Boston, USA, Hardcore/Punk
..”raging UK82-in-‘22 pogo joy and the perfect soundtrack for cheap cider and solvent abuse. Snotty, amphetamine-rapid riffs, sneered vocals sticking two fingers up to every establishment of which you can think, and pounding drums that feel like the heartbeat of an anxiety attack. People will compare this to yer ABRASIVE WHEELS, yer SKEPTIX, yer PARTISANS, etc.,” – https://www.maximumrocknroll.com/band/savageheads/
https://socialnapalm.bandcamp.com/album/service-to-your-country
APPÄRATUS (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)
MALAYSIA DBEAT MANIAXXX
APPÄRATUS have been playing total d-beat raw punk mangel since 2000 – now they’re coming to OCCII to cause some mayhem!
Think classic Scandinavian style, a rawer version of Anti Cimex, Shitlickers, Mob 47 etc!
https://apparatuspunk.bandcamp.com/
BURNING KROSS
New order? No order! Disorder!
East & West Flanders (Belgium) united. Angry, fast and pissed off hardcore punk with faces you might have seen in RIP bands (Cheap Drugs, Permanent Debt, Gagged).
FFO: Negative FX, Reagan Youth & Jerry’s Kids.
https://burningkross.bandcamp.com/
https://www.instagram.com/burning_kross/

title: L&S (FR/NL, Anthony Laguerre & G.W. Sok) + SPACE SIREN
pageInfoID: L&S (FR/NL, Anthony Laguerre & G.W. Sok) + SPACE SIREN - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent: Friday, June 30, 2023 IN OK/OUT KO! Rock Doors open: 20:00 Showtime: 21:00 Damage: €10 (rsvp) | €12,50 (door) L&S a project by Anthony Laguerre & G.W. Sok + SPACE SIREN (Aico, Gwendolien & Ineke + Cees & Bart of HOWRAH) L&S is an ambitious musical adventure, mixing rock and poetry with a symphony orchestra. The name of this band is short. Its musical history, however, long and divers. The new project of ANTHONY LAGUERRE (Nancy) and G.W. SOK (Amsterdam) arose out of the afterglow ashes of Filiamotsa (2007-2016), a band from the east of France that ceased to exist at the end of 2016. Their first full length album together was with Laguerre’s aforementioned group, which Sok had joined in 2014. In 2015 they released ‘Like It Is’, a harbinger of what was to come several years later. Laguerre (Myotis, Praag) and Sok (co-founder of The Ex and their singer till 2009, afterwards in bands such as Oiseaux-Tempête, Action Beat, ex-King Champion Sounds and lots more) embarked in 2020 on their challenging escapade, during which they desired to bring together rock, poetry and a symphony orchestra. A desire which made Sok take care of the texts (inspired by poets such as Ginsberg and Prévert), while Laguerre focused on the compositions (inspired too, by Gainsbourg for example). They brought in Eric Thomas on guitar and Jean-Michel Pires (Oiseaux-Tempête, Bruit Noir, Mendelson) on drums, and then joined forces with the Gradus Ad Musicam orchestra from Nancy. In September 2022 the result of all this, their album ‘WHEN THE VOWELS FALL‘ was set free into the world. “Basically, the two bring alternative rock with a cinematic and poetic slant, which is less contrary than you may be used to from them. But make no mistake, the melancholy and the feelings they have incorporated are pretty intense (in a positive way, that is). The classical instruments certainly do not smooth things over, but only accentuate the emotions and manage to make the impact of the music land a little softer in a beautiful way. (…) The strong lyrics and music already make a deep impression, which is due to the eloquence of the vocals, half-songs and spoken word of G.W. Sock is taken to an even higher level. They operate at the crossroads where experimentation, avant-garde, rock, classical music and artistic beauty converge. (…) Both gentlemen really deliver an inimitable masterpiece here with their guests.” — JW Broek/De Subjectivisten, Sept. 26th, 2022 Due to obvious practical reasons L&S performs live mainly as a four-piece. With the same impact, though, as when they would play together with an orchestra. “It remains to evoke the summit of this festival, one of those rare, exceptional moments, which rumor will soon tell you that you should have been there. As the storm rose on the Ponant, L&S blew a wind of poetry, and poured out, without splashing, the contained rage of a big sound without violence. The association of Lorraine bassist Anthony Laguerre and Dutch singer-writer G.W Sok, the friction of writing, thought and dark atmosphere, in tune with a world that laughs very little, produced a musical spark as we do not hear every spring. Neither rock nor jazz, this coherent universe, without frills, summons references such as Lou Reed, The Fall, the twilight Johnny Cash or the last embers of a dying Bashung. (…) a staggering project, which has bided its time during two years of pandemic.” — Le Télégramme, Oct. 21st 2022 G.W. Sok – vocals Anthony Laguerre – guitar, bass, orchestra-samples Jean-Michel Pires – drums Eric Thomas – guitar L&S // CAN’T BREATHE // WHEN THE VOWELS FALL
longTextHTML:
L&S  a project by Anthony Laguerre & G.W. Sok + SPACE SIREN (Aico, Gwendolien & Ineke + Cees & Bart of HOWRAH)

L&S is an ambitious musical adventure, mixing rock and poetry with a symphony orchestra. The name of this band is short. Its musical history, however, long and divers. The new project of ANTHONY LAGUERRE (Nancy) and G.W. SOK (Amsterdam) arose out of the afterglow ashes of Filiamotsa (2007-2016), a band from the east of France that ceased to exist at the end of 2016. Their first full length album together was with Laguerre’s aforementioned group, which Sok had joined in 2014. In 2015 they released ‘Like It Is’, a harbinger of what was to come several years later.
Laguerre (Myotis, Praag) and Sok (co-founder of The Ex and their singer till 2009, afterwards in bands such as Oiseaux-Tempête, Action Beat, ex-King Champion Sounds and lots more) embarked in 2020 on their challenging escapade, during which they desired to bring together rock, poetry and a symphony orchestra. A desire which made Sok take care of the texts (inspired by poets such as Ginsberg and Prévert), while Laguerre focused on the compositions (inspired too, by Gainsbourg for example). They brought in Eric Thomas on guitar and Jean-Michel Pires (Oiseaux-Tempête, Bruit Noir, Mendelson) on drums, and then joined forces with the Gradus Ad Musicam orchestra from Nancy.

In September 2022 the result of all this, their album ‘WHEN THE VOWELS FALL‘ was set free into the world.

“Basically, the two bring alternative rock with a cinematic and poetic slant, which is less contrary than you may be used to from them. But make no mistake, the melancholy and the feelings they have incorporated are pretty intense (in a positive way, that is). The classical instruments certainly do not smooth things over, but only accentuate the emotions and manage to make the impact of the music land a little softer in a beautiful way. (…) The strong lyrics and music already make a deep impression, which is due to the eloquence of the vocals, half-songs and spoken word of G.W. Sock is taken to an even higher level. They operate at the crossroads where experimentation, avant-garde, rock, classical music and artistic beauty converge. (…) Both gentlemen really deliver an inimitable masterpiece here with their guests.” — JW Broek/De Subjectivisten, Sept. 26th, 2022

Due to obvious practical reasons L&S performs live mainly as a four-piece. With the same impact, though, as when they would play together with an orchestra.

“It remains to evoke the summit of this festival, one of those rare, exceptional moments, which rumor will soon tell you that you should have been there. As the storm rose on the Ponant, L&S blew a wind of poetry, and poured out, without splashing, the contained rage of a big sound without violence. The association of Lorraine bassist Anthony Laguerre and Dutch singer-writer G.W Sok, the friction of writing, thought and dark atmosphere, in tune with a world that laughs very little, produced a musical spark as we do not hear every spring. Neither rock nor jazz, this coherent universe, without frills, summons references such as Lou Reed, The Fall, the twilight Johnny Cash or the last embers of a dying Bashung. (…) a staggering project, which has bided its time during two years of pandemic.” — Le Télégramme, Oct. 21st 2022

G.W. Sok – vocals
Anthony Laguerre – guitar, bass, orchestra-samples
Jean-Michel Pires – drums
Eric Thomas – guitar

L&S // CAN’T BREATHE // WHEN THE VOWELS FALL

SPACE SIREN
Yes, we know it is and isn’t, of course. But Bart and Cees from Howrah go some way to fill guitarist Corno Zwetsloot’s shoes. Expect some absolute golden moments from one of the greatest Dutch independent rock bands in the last 20 years and one of the true kickstarters of what is now called the Dutch underground. Those who know, know.
Layered guitars and a sweet succulent voice pull you in and spit you out – gently. Indie band Space Siren is moody without being too heavy, and catchy without being too poppy. Their songs sound like they know where they’re going, but they’ll never let you in on the secret. They have that forward drive every band should have: the sound of needing to make music, not just wanting to.

https://www.instagram.com/_space_siren_/
https://www.facebook.com/spacesiren

title: Diploid + Son of Seth + Dooie Mus + salutingrome
shortText: Pretty//Ugly | The Invention & Future of Music
pageInfoID: Diploid + Son of Seth + Dooie Mus + salutingrome - OCCII | Onafhankelijk Cultureel Centrum In It
priceTextcontent: Saturday, July 15, 2023 Pretty // Ugly Doors open: 20:00 Showtime: 20:30 Damage: 10 Presented by Pretty//Ugly FFO: The Body / Full of Hell / Uniform / Mind Eraser / Posh Isolation / Trepaneringsritualen Diploid (Australia) Since 2010, Diploid have been a primal force searing underneath the pyre of Australian heavy music. Crushing, urgent, depressing and fierce, few can stand toe to toe with the blistering vocals, thematic despair and rapid-fire instrumentals that strike straight at a listener’s pressure points. Diploid are antithetic to peace. Heavyweights such as Full of Hell, Cancer Bats and Integrity have all slotted Diploid on support for their shows. Heavy Experimental pioneers The Body have performed a collaborative improvised set with Diploid in 2019, and the band have blasted eardrums on tour in Japan, Indonesia, Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea, New Zealand and Australia. https://diploid.bandcamp.com/ https://www.instagram.com/diploidnoise/ Son of Seth (Denmark) Son of Seth is a Death-Industrial/Black/Doom- Drone project, from Copenhagen, Denmark. Tiago Dias (vocals: Bastard grave) is the mind and the sole composer behind this project. The music is bleak and shrouded in ritual, with cathartic live performances that entangle the listener in a world of suffering and misery. In this dark gloomy place, the audience is faced with their own inner doubts and callous thoughts. Combining heavy distorted synths with field recordings and sound design, elements, where sounds are mangled and given life, SON OF SETH ́S dystopic universe is conceived and presented to the audience. Shrieking powerful vocals, further drag you down, into a feeling of uncertainty and unease, and create a gripping atmosphere. SON OF SETH has shared the stage with artists such as, Anna Von Hausswolf, Offermose, Brighter Death Now, Of the Wand & the moon, Duma, Luis Vasques (The soft Moon), abysmal grief, just to name a few. the latest release, “De dor a ódio” is out on Trepanation Recordings (UK), and available on cassette & CD, and all digital platforms. https://sonofseth.bandcamp.com/album/de-dor-a-odio https://www.instagram.com/sonofseth_/ Dooie Mus Dooie mus is a two piece screamo band. These idiots play fast and loud. At least most of the time https://dooiemus.bandcamp.com/album/humans Salutingrome Salutingrome started as the aperture for the solo musical experiments of Zamity Mitelembe, but is now a dignified rockband. With Victor Keyser on guitar and Tijmen Aalberts on drums. The project started out with the wallowing strings of folk and industrial tinged music, but quickly evolved into something more profound. Without leaving the drama origins behind, the band plays an abrasive, evocative mix of noise rock, post-punk, and blues. To some they are one of the most challenging bands to emerge live right now. https://auralconduct.bandcamp.com/album/washing-hands Poster photo: Jose Estevao de Conceicao DIPLOID, DOOIE MUS, Salutingrome, SON OF SETH Bookings Payments can be made through iDeal / SEPA / PAYPAL / Credit Card Tickets Price€10,00 Spaces 1 2 Registration Information Terms: I have read and agree to the Terms & Conditions * Payment and Confirmation I consent to my submitted data being collected and stored as outlined by the site
longTextHTML:
Presented by Pretty//Ugly

FFO: The Body / Full of Hell / Uniform / Mind Eraser / Posh Isolation / Trepaneringsritualen

Diploid (Australia)

Since 2010, Diploid have been a primal force searing underneath the pyre of Australian heavy
music. Crushing, urgent, depressing and fierce, few can stand toe to toe with the blistering vocals,
thematic despair and rapid-fire instrumentals that strike straight at a listener’s pressure points.
Diploid are antithetic to peace.
Heavyweights such as Full of Hell, Cancer Bats and Integrity have all slotted Diploid on support for
their shows. Heavy Experimental pioneers The Body have performed a collaborative improvised
set with Diploid in 2019, and the band have blasted eardrums on tour in Japan, Indonesia,
Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea, New Zealand and Australia.

https://diploid.bandcamp.com/

https://www.instagram.com/diploidnoise/

Son of Seth (Denmark)

Son of Seth is a Death-Industrial/Black/Doom- Drone project, from Copenhagen, Denmark.

Tiago Dias (vocals: Bastard grave) is the mind and the sole composer behind this project.
The music is bleak and shrouded in ritual, with cathartic live performances that entangle the listener in a world of suffering and misery. In this dark gloomy place, the audience is faced with their own inner doubts and callous thoughts.

Combining heavy distorted synths with field recordings and sound design, elements, where sounds are mangled and given life, SON OF SETH ́S dystopic universe is conceived and presented to the audience. Shrieking powerful vocals, further drag you down, into a feeling of uncertainty and unease, and create a
gripping atmosphere.

SON OF SETH has shared the stage with artists such as, Anna Von Hausswolf, Offermose, Brighter Death Now, Of
the Wand & the moon, Duma, Luis Vasques (The soft Moon), abysmal grief, just to name a few.
the latest release, “De dor a ódio” is out on Trepanation Recordings (UK), and available on cassette & CD,
and all digital platforms.

https://sonofseth.bandcamp.com/album/de-dor-a-odio

https://www.instagram.com/sonofseth_/

Dooie Mus

Dooie mus is a two piece screamo band. These idiots play fast and loud. At least most of the time

https://dooiemus.bandcamp.com/album/humans

Salutingrome

Salutingrome started as the aperture for the solo musical experiments of Zamity Mitelembe, but is now a dignified rockband. With Victor Keyser on guitar and Tijmen Aalberts on drums. The project started out with the wallowing strings of folk and industrial tinged music, but quickly evolved into something more profound. Without leaving the drama origins behind, the band plays an abrasive, evocative mix of noise rock, post-punk, and blues. To some they are one of the most challenging bands to emerge live right now.
